Calculate tcrdist between two single TCRs Pass empty strings for missing CDR sequences

Source: R/extendr-wrappers.R, R/tcrdist.R
tcrdist_single.Rd

Calculates the tcrdist distance between two T-cell receptors using BLOSUM62 amino acid substitution scoring and Needleman-Wunsch alignment. This is a convenience function for comparing just two TCRs.

Usage

tcrdist_single(
  cdr1_a_1,
  cdr2_a_1,
  cdr3_a_1,
  cdr1_b_1,
  cdr2_b_1,
  cdr3_b_1,
  cdr1_a_2,
  cdr2_a_2,
  cdr3_a_2,
  cdr1_b_2,
  cdr2_b_2,
  cdr3_b_2
)

Arguments

cdr1_a_1

Character, CDR1 alpha sequence of first TCR (use "" for missing)

cdr2_a_1

Character, CDR2 alpha sequence of first TCR (use "" for missing)

cdr3_a_1

Character, CDR3 alpha sequence of first TCR (use "" for missing)

cdr1_b_1

Character, CDR1 beta sequence of first TCR (use "" for missing)

cdr2_b_1

Character, CDR2 beta sequence of first TCR (use "" for missing)

cdr3_b_1

Character, CDR3 beta sequence of first TCR (use "" for missing)

cdr1_a_2

Character, CDR1 alpha sequence of second TCR (use "" for missing)

cdr2_a_2

Character, CDR2 alpha sequence of second TCR (use "" for missing)

cdr3_a_2

Character, CDR3 alpha sequence of second TCR (use "" for missing)

cdr1_b_2

Character, CDR1 beta sequence of second TCR (use "" for missing)

cdr2_b_2

Character, CDR2 beta sequence of second TCR (use "" for missing)

cdr3_b_2

Character, CDR3 beta sequence of second TCR (use "" for missing)

Value

Numeric value representing the tcrdist distance between the two TCRs. Lower values indicate more similar TCRs.

Details

This function uses the same algorithm as calculate_tcrdist but is optimized for comparing a single pair of TCRs. The distance calculation combines distances from CDR1, CDR2, and CDR3 regions of both alpha and beta chains, with CDR3 weighted 3x more heavily than CDR1/2.

See calculate_tcrdist for detailed information about the tcrdist algorithm and distance interpretation.

Distance Interpretation

  • 0: Identical TCRs

  • < 50: Very similar, likely same epitope specificity

  • 50-100: Moderate similarity

  • > 100: Dissimilar TCRs

References

Dash P, Fiore-Gartland AJ, Hertz T, et al. (2017) Quantifiable predictive features define epitope-specific T cell receptor repertoires. Nature, 547(7661):89-93. doi:10.1038/nature22383

See also

calculate_tcrdist for pairwise distances between multiple TCRs

Examples

# Compare two TCRs (CDR3 only)
dist <- tcrdist_single(
  cdr1_a_1 = "", cdr2_a_1 = "", cdr3_a_1 = "CAASNRGSTLGRLYF",
  cdr1_b_1 = "", cdr2_b_1 = "", cdr3_b_1 = "CASSLTGNTEAFF",
  cdr1_a_2 = "", cdr2_a_2 = "", cdr3_a_2 = "CAASIRSSYKLIF",
  cdr1_b_2 = "", cdr2_b_2 = "", cdr3_b_2 = "CASSLGQGAYEQYF"
)
print(paste("Distance:", dist))
#> [1] "Distance: 207"

# Compare identical TCRs (should be 0)
dist_same <- tcrdist_single(
  "", "", "CASSF", "", "", "CASSF",
  "", "", "CASSF", "", "", "CASSF"
)
print(paste("Distance between identical TCRs:", dist_same))  # Should be 0
#> [1] "Distance between identical TCRs: 0"

# Compare with all CDR regions
dist_full <- tcrdist_single(
  cdr1_a_1 = "TGTGC", cdr2_a_1 = "TGTGC", cdr3_a_1 = "CASSF",
  cdr1_b_1 = "TGTGC", cdr2_b_1 = "TGTGC", cdr3_b_1 = "CASSF",
  cdr1_a_2 = "TGTGA", cdr2_a_2 = "TGTGA", cdr3_a_2 = "CASSLF",
  cdr1_b_2 = "TGTGA", cdr2_b_2 = "TGTGA", cdr3_b_2 = "CASSLF"
)
print(paste("Distance with all CDRs:", dist_full))
#> [1] "Distance with all CDRs: 64"
